"use client" import { useState } from "react"; import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Navigation } from "@/components/Navigation"; import { ProjectSelector } from "@/components/ProjectSelector"; import { useProject } from "@/lib/project-context"; import part1SceneData from "../scenes/blank-pantherscene-breakdown-agent copy/output.json"; import part2SceneData from "../scenes/blank-pantherscene-breakdown-agent copy/ouput.json"; import { Film, Clock, DollarSign, MapPin, Users, Camera, Lightbulb, Mic, Palette, AlertTriangle, Search, Filter, FileText, BarChart3, Zap, Truck, PawPrint, TrendingUp, Timer, Target } from "lucide-react"; type SceneData = typeof part1SceneData; type Scene = SceneData['sceneBreakdownOutput']['detailedSceneBreakdowns'][0]; export default function SceneBreakdownPage() { const { selectedProject } = useProject(); const [selectedPart, setSelectedPart] = useState<1 | 2>(1); // Set initial scene to scene 1 for Part 1 const [selectedScene, setSelectedScene] = useState(1); // Get data from both JSON files const part1Data = part1SceneData.sceneBreakdownOutput.detailedSceneBreakdowns; const part2Data = part2SceneData.sceneBreakdownOutput.detailedSceneBreakdowns; // Transform Part 1 data to show scenes 1-100 (map scenes 101-196 to 1-96) const part1Scenes = part1Data.map(scene => ({ ...scene, sceneNumber: scene.sceneNumber - 100 // Map 101->1, 102->2, etc. })); // Part 2 uses the original data as-is (scenes 101-196) const part2Scenes = part2Data; // Define the display ranges based on requirements const part1Range = part1Scenes.length > 0 ? `Scenes 1-100` : 'No scenes'; const part2Range = part2Scenes.length > 0 ? `Scenes ${Math.min(...part2Scenes.map(s => s.sceneNumber))}-${Math.max(...part2Scenes.map(s => s.sceneNumber))}` : 'No scenes'; // Get current scenes and summary based on selected part const scenes = selectedPart === 1 ? part1Scenes : part2Scenes; const currentDataSource = selectedPart === 1 ? part1SceneData : part2SceneData; const summary = { ...currentDataSource.sceneBreakdownOutput.sceneAnalysisSummary, totalScenesProcessed: scenes.length, totalCharactersIdentified: new Set(scenes.flatMap(s => s.characters.speaking.map(c => c.name))).size, totalLocationsIdentified: new Set(scenes.map(s => s.location.primaryLocation)).size }; const getComplexityColor = (complexity: number) => { if (complexity >= 8) return "destructive"; if (complexity >= 6) return "outline"; return "secondary"; }; const getComplexityLabel = (complexity: number) => { if (complexity >= 8) return "Extreme"; if (complexity >= 6) return "High"; if (complexity >= 4) return "Medium"; return "Low"; }; const selectedSceneData = scenes.find(s => s.sceneNumber === selectedScene) || scenes[0]; return (

"use client" import { useState } from "react"; import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Navigation } from "@/components/Navigation"; import { ProjectSelector } from "@/components/ProjectSelector"; import { useProject } from "@/lib/project-context"; import part1SceneData from "./blank-pantherscene-breakdown-agent copy/output.json"; import part2SceneData from "./blank-pantherscene-breakdown-agent copy/ouput.json"; import { Film, Clock, DollarSign, MapPin, Users, Camera, Lightbulb, Mic, Palette, AlertTriangle, Search, Filter, FileText, BarChart3, Zap, Truck, PawPrint, TrendingUp, Timer, Target } from "lucide-react"; type SceneData = typeof part1SceneData; type Scene = SceneData['sceneBreakdownOutput']['detailedSceneBreakdowns'][0]; export default function SceneBreakdownPage() { const { selectedProject } = useProject(); const [selectedPart, setSelectedPart] = useState<1 | 2>(1); // Set initial scene to scene 1 for Part 1 const [selectedScene, setSelectedScene] = useState(1); // Get data from both JSON files const part1Data = part1SceneData.sceneBreakdownOutput.detailedSceneBreakdowns; const part2Data = part2SceneData.sceneBreakdownOutput.detailedSceneBreakdowns; // Use data as-is from JSON files without any mapping const part1Scenes = part1Data; const part2Scenes = part2Data; // Show actual scene ranges from the JSON data const part1Range = part1Scenes.length > 0 ? `Scenes ${Math.min(...part1Scenes.map(s => s.sceneNumber))}-${Math.max(...part1Scenes.map(s => s.sceneNumber))}` : 'No scenes'; const part2Range = part2Scenes.length > 0 ? `Scenes ${Math.min(...part2Scenes.map(s => s.sceneNumber))}-${Math.max(...part2Scenes.map(s => s.sceneNumber))}` : 'No scenes'; // Get current scenes and summary based on selected part const scenes = selectedPart === 1 ? part1Scenes : part2Scenes; const currentDataSource = selectedPart === 1 ? part1SceneData : part2SceneData; const summary = { ...currentDataSource.sceneBreakdownOutput.sceneAnalysisSummary, totalScenesProcessed: scenes.length, totalCharactersIdentified: new Set(scenes.flatMap(s => s.characters.speaking.map(c => c.name))).size, totalLocationsIdentified: new Set(scenes.map(s => s.location.primaryLocation)).size }; const getComplexityColor = (complexity: number) => { if (complexity >= 8) return "destructive"; if (complexity >= 6) return "outline"; return "secondary"; }; const getComplexityLabel = (complexity: number) => { if (complexity >= 8) return "Extreme"; if (complexity >= 6) return "High"; if (complexity >= 4) return "Medium"; return "Low"; }; const selectedSceneData = scenes.find(s => s.sceneNumber === selectedScene) || scenes[0]; return (

"use client" import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Navigation } from "@/components/Navigation"; import { ProjectSelector } from "@/components/ProjectSelector"; import { useProject } from "@/lib/project-context"; import { Film, Clock, FileText, Users, MapPin, Camera, Mic, Palette, Download, Eye, BookOpen } from "lucide-react"; export default function ScriptPage() { const { selectedProject } = useProject(); // Sample script content const scriptContent = `FADE IN: EXT. WAKANDA - DAWN OF TIME - DAY OVER BLACK. The distant thunder of drums. Growing stronger, closer. The black gives way to BEAUTIFUL SWIRLING NEBULAE... A meteor, glowing with otherworldly energy, hurtles through space toward a lush, green continent. Africa. NARRATOR (V.O.) Millions of years ago, a meteorite made of vibranium, the strongest substance in the universe, struck the continent of Africa, affecting the plant life around it. The meteor CRASHES into the earth with tremendous force. The impact sends shockwaves rippling outward... Over time, five tribes settled on it and called it Wakanda. The tribes lived in constant war with each other until a warrior shaman received a vision from the panther goddess Bast. INT. ANCIENT WAKANDAN CAVE - DAY A WARRIOR SHAMAN kneels before a glowing, blue plant - a heart-shaped herb enhanced by vibranium. Mystical energy swirls around him. NARRATOR (V.O.) She led him to the heart-shaped herb, which granted him superhuman strength, speed and instincts. The shaman's eyes glow with power. He transforms, becoming the first BLACK PANTHER. NARRATOR (V.O.) He became the first Black Panther, and united the tribes. But one tribe, the Jabari, challenged his rule and chose to live in isolation in the mountains. EXT. WAKANDA - VARIOUS LOCATIONS - DAY MONTAGE showing the five tribes working together, building an advanced civilization hidden from the world. NARRATOR (V.O.) The Wakandans used vibranium to develop advanced technology and isolate themselves from the world by posing as a third world country. CUT TO: INT. SMALL APARTMENT - OAKLAND - NIGHT (1992) Two young boys, YOUNG N'JOBU'S SON (8) and his FRIEND (12), play with action figures on a worn carpet. YOUNG N'JOBU'S SON Wassup, Uncle? N'JOBU (30s), enters. Despite his youth, he carries himself with the bearing of Wakandan royalty, though he's dressed like any other Oakland resident. N'JOBU Hey. Where's your dad? YOUNG N'JOBU'S SON He's not back yet.`; return (
{/* Header */}

Black Panther - Script

Total Pages

Black Panther

Ryan J. Coogler & Joe Robert Cole

Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi

January 15, 2017
); }

"use client" import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Navigation } from "@/components/Navigation"; import { ProjectSelector } from "@/components/ProjectSelector"; import { useProject } from "@/lib/project-context"; import { Film, Clock, FileText, Users, MapPin, Camera, Mic, Palette, Download, Eye, BookOpen } from "lucide-react"; export default function ScriptPage() { const { selectedProject } = useProject(); // Sample script content const scriptContent = `FADE IN: EXT. WAKANDA - DAWN OF TIME - DAY OVER BLACK. The distant thunder of drums. Growing stronger, closer. The black gives way to BEAUTIFUL SWIRLING NEBULAE... A meteor, glowing with otherworldly energy, hurtles through space toward a lush, green continent. Africa. NARRATOR (V.O.) Millions of years ago, a meteorite made of vibranium, the strongest substance in the universe, struck the continent of Africa, affecting the plant life around it. The meteor CRASHES into the earth with tremendous force. The impact sends shockwaves rippling outward... Over time, five tribes settled on it and called it Wakanda. The tribes lived in constant war with each other until a warrior shaman received a vision from the panther goddess Bast. INT. ANCIENT WAKANDAN CAVE - DAY A WARRIOR SHAMAN kneels before a glowing, blue plant - a heart-shaped herb enhanced by vibranium. Mystical energy swirls around him. NARRATOR (V.O.) She led him to the heart-shaped herb, which granted him superhuman strength, speed and instincts. The shaman's eyes glow with power. He transforms, becoming the first BLACK PANTHER. NARRATOR (V.O.) He became the first Black Panther, and united the tribes. But one tribe, the Jabari, challenged his rule and chose to live in isolation in the mountains. EXT. WAKANDA - VARIOUS LOCATIONS - DAY MONTAGE showing the five tribes working together, building an advanced civilization hidden from the world. NARRATOR (V.O.) The Wakandans used vibranium to develop advanced technology and isolate themselves from the world by posing as a third world country. CUT TO: INT. SMALL APARTMENT - OAKLAND - NIGHT (1992) Two young boys, YOUNG N'JOBU'S SON (8) and his FRIEND (12), play with action figures on a worn carpet. YOUNG N'JOBU'S SON Wassup, Uncle? N'JOBU (30s), enters. Despite his youth, he carries himself with the bearing of Wakandan royalty, though he's dressed like any other Oakland resident. N'JOBU Hey. Where's your dad? YOUNG N'JOBU'S SON He's not back yet.`; return (
